messages.content: Why should CalDigit users upgrade their Macs to macOS 13 Ventura?

We encourage all CalDigit users to upgrade their Macs to macOS 13 Ventura for the best possible experience. This new OS version has resolved small compatibility issues with external devices, and offers a better user experience, especially for people connecting docks to their Macs.
What new device connection protection does macOS 13 Ventura offer?

Starting from macOS 13, Ventura, Apple has implemented a new layer of device connection protection on portable Macs with Apple silicon, such as the M1 and M2. Any new USB or Thunderbolt devices require user approval before the device can communicate with macOS for connections wired directly to the USB4/Thunderbolt 4 port. When a new USB or Thunderbolt device is connected to a Mac, the user will be asked to approve the connection from the pop-up window.
What should you do if your CalDigit device is not recognized by macOS Ventura?

If you find your CalDigit dock, storage, or any devices connected directly or indirectly to a CalDigit device are working properly prior to macOS 13, but cannot be recognized by macOS Ventura, please ensure you 'allow' the connection when you are asked to approve the connection from the pop-up window.
How can you change the security configuration for USB/Thunderbolt devices in macOS Ventura?

You can change this security configuration in System Settings -> Privacy & Security -> and scroll down to the 'Security' section. The default configuration is 'Ask for New Accessories', you can change this to 'Ask Every Time', 'Automatically When Unlocked' or 'Always'. Approved USB/Thunderbolt devices can connect to a locked Mac for up to three days.
What should you do if the pop-up window asking to allow device connection does not appear in macOS Ventura?

If the pop-up window asking you to allow for the device connection does not appear, or if it appeared for a moment and you didn’t have the opportunity to click it, this will result in nothing behind the CalDigit device or dock working. For example, external monitors and external drives connected to a CalDigit dock will not work. Please change 'Allow accessories to connect' to 'Always' in order for all attached devices to connect as normal.
What steps should you take if your external display connected to your Thunderbolt Dock or Hub does not work after updating to macOS Ventura?

If you find the external display connected to your Thunderbolt Dock or Hub no longer work properly after updating to Ventura, please try to update to macOS 13.1 or later. If you still have the external monitor problem, please try to boot to safe mode, reconnect the dock, and then restart your Mac and boot back to the normal mode. To start up your Mac in safe mode, please follow the steps on Apple’s support article: https://support.apple.com/guide/mac-help/start-up-your-mac-in-safe-mode-mh21245/mac
How can you resolve display flickering issues under macOS Ventura?

Please turn off 'Variable Refresh Rate' (VRR) or Adaptive Sync such as G-Sync or FreeSync feature from your external display’s OSD menu (on-screen display) if your display is flickering under Ventura.
Why might drive capacity appear different across various operating systems?

Determining drive capacity can be confusing because the different OS platforms may use different measurement standards. Both binary and decimal measurements are commonly used in Mac OSX and Windows systems. In either case, a drive’s capacity is measured by using the total number of bytes available on the drive. As long as the drive displays the correct number of bytes, you are getting the drive’s full capacity.
What are the two most common ways to display hard disk or SSD capacity?
The most common two ways to display hard disk’s or SSD’s capacity are Decimal and Binary methods.
How do decimal measurements define megabyte, gigabyte, and terabyte?
For simplicity and consistency, some define a megabyte as 1,000,000 bytes, a gigabyte as 1,000,000,000 bytes and a terabyte as 1,000,000,000,000 bytes. This is referred to as Decimal measurement.
How do binary measurements define megabyte, gigabyte, and terabyte?

Some, including Windows and older versions of Mac OSX, actually define a megabyte as 1,048,576 bytes, a gigabyte as 1,073,741,824 bytes and a terabyte as 1,099,511,627,776 bytes. This is referred to as Binary measurements.
Why do different utilities and OS platforms report different capacities for the same drive?

This is why different utilities and OS platforms report different capacities for the same drive. The number of bytes may be the same, but a different number of bytes is used to make a megabyte, a gigabyte and a terabyte. For example, CalDigit VR2 10TB displays 9,315GB in Windows, 9 TB on the LCD menu, but shows 10TB in Mac OSX.
What might cause a small discrepancy in reported drive capacity in CalDigit RAID storage?
Note: Some CalDigit RAID storage would reserve small capacities, normally few megabytes, for RAID table and configuration.
What is the procedure for resetting NVRAM on Intel-based Macs that include non-Thunderbolt and Thunderbolt 1, 2 models?

1. The following steps show the NVRAM resetting for your Macs which includes non-Thunderbolt, and Thunderbolt 1, 2 Macs:
  - A. Shut down your Mac.
  - B. Find Command (⌘), Option, P, and R on your keyboard.
  - C. Turn on your Mac.
  - D. Press and hold the Command-Option-P-R keys immediately after you hear the startup sound.
  - E. Hold these keys until the computer restarts and you hear the startup sound for a second time.
  - F. Repeat D and E until you hear the 4th startup sound then release the keys.
How do you reset NVRAM on Thunderbolt 3 Macs, such as late-2016 and 2017 MacBook Pro models?

2. The following steps show the NVRAM resetting for your Thunderbolt 3 Macs which includes late-2016 and 2017 MacBook Pro models:
  - A. Shut down your Mac.
  - B. Find Command (⌘), Option, P, and R on your keyboard.
  - C. Turn on your Mac.
  - D. Press and hold the Command-Option-P-R keys immediately after you turn on your Mac.
  - E. Hold these keys down for at least 60 seconds to ensure that your Mac completes the process correctly. You will not hear any startup sound during this process and the Mac’s monitor will show nothing on the screen.
  - F. Release the keys.
What steps should you follow to reset the SMC on a Mac laptop with a non-removable battery?

3. The following steps show the SMC resetting for the Mac laptop that has a non-removable battery. Most Mac laptops from 2015 have a non-removable battery:
  - A. Shut down your Mac.
  - B. Using the built-in keyboard, press Shift-Control-Option on the left side of the keyboard, then press the power button at the same time. Hold these keys and the power button for 10 seconds.
  - If you have a Thunderbolt 3 MacBook Pro with Touch ID, the Touch ID button is also the power button.
  - C. Release all keys.
  - D. Press the power button again to turn on your Mac.
How do you reset the SMC on a Mac laptop with a removable battery?

4. The following steps show the SMC resetting for the Mac laptop that has a removable battery:
  - A. Shut down your Mac.
  - B. Remove the battery. (Please refer to Apple support page.)
  - C. Press and hold the power button for five seconds.
  - D. Press the power button to turn on your Mac.
What is the procedure for resetting the SMC on a Mac desktop, such as iMac, Mac mini, or Mac Pro?

5. The following steps show the SMC resetting for the Mac desktop such as iMac, Mac mini, and Mac Pro:
  - A. Shut down your Mac.
  - B. Unplug the power cord.
  - C. Wait 15 seconds.
  - D. Plug the power cord back in.
  - E. Wait five seconds, then press the power button to turn on your Mac.
How do you find the CYUSB3610.kext driver file in macOS 10.13?
1. From Finder, click on your macOS disk, then go to /Library/StagedExtensions/Library/Extensions/ folder, and look for CYUSB3610.kext.
What should you do if the CYUSB3610.kext driver file shows ‘staff’ in the Sharing & Permissions list?

If you see ‘staff’ in the list, this means your driver was not properly installed and must be removed from this folder. Since the ‘StagedExtensions’ folder is protected by macOS, deleting files located in this folder is not allowed. You can boot to a separate macOS disk or boot to ‘Recovery Mode’ and then manually delete this driver file (KEXT) on this disk.
How do you boot into Recovery Mode on macOS 10.13?

To boot into Recovery Mode, restart your Mac. As your Mac restarts, hold down the Command (⌘) – R combination immediately. Hold the keys until the Apple logo appears. Note: If your OS drive is encrypted, you need to turn off encryption from Disk Utility first before it can show in the Terminal utility below. To do that, open Disk Utility and select your locked hard drive. Under the File menu, select Turn Off Encryption.
What steps should you follow after entering Recovery Mode to delete the problematic driver file?

- E. Go to the Utilities menu on the top and select ‘Terminal’. 
  - F. Use the listed terminal commands to navigate to the folder where the problematic kext driver file is on your macOS disk, and delete that driver. It’s located in Your macOS Drive/Library/StagedExtensions/Library/Extensions/. Note: All the commands, folder, and file names in Terminal are case sensitive.
What should you do after deleting the problematic driver file in Recovery Mode?
Exit the Recovery Mode and boot back to your macOS. Then reinstall the latest CalDigit driver.
What should you do if you receive a ‘System Extension Blocked’ alert message when installing software on macOS 10.13 or later?
Click ‘OK,’ then proceed to Security & Privacy to enable the kernel extension to complete the installation.
How do you access the Security & Privacy settings to approve a blocked kernel extension on macOS 10.13 or later?

1. Click on the Apple icon.
2. Open System Preferences.
3. Go to Security & Privacy.
4. You may need to unlock the pane. Click on the lock icon at the bottom of the pane, then enter your admin password. If you are sharing the computer in your organization and do not know the admin password, please consult with your IT support team.
5. Click on the ‘Allow’ button displayed in front of the blocked software.
What additional step is required when installing the USB-C Dock Ethernet Driver on macOS 10.13 or later?
You will need to allow system software from the developer ‘Cypress Semiconductor.’
What options do you have after clicking ‘OK’ on the ‘System Extension Blocked’ alert?
Click ‘Restart’ to restart your computer right away or ‘OK’ if you prefer to manually restart your computer.
What should you do if you experience issues with Thunderbolt or Display connections after troubleshooting?
Try resetting your NVRAM. For detailed instructions, visit [Apple's support article](https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT204063).
How can you reinstall macOS without losing personal data to fix unresolvable issues?
Reinstall macOS and restore core system files and drivers without deleting any personal data. Follow the steps in [Apple's support article](https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT204904).
Why might your USB keyboard and mouse not work during macOS login with FileVault enabled?

With FileVault encryption enabled, your USB keyboard and mouse may not work until you log in to macOS because FileVault uses the EFI pre-boot environment, and macOS drivers do not load until after login.
How can you log in to macOS if your keyboard and mouse connected through a Thunderbolt dock are unresponsive?

Use the internal keyboard if you have a laptop, or connect the keyboard to a built-in USB port on your MacPro. After logging in, all drivers will load, and your keyboard and mouse will function properly.
What are the two possible solutions to address issues with default sound output devices when using Thunderbolt docks with FileVault enabled?

1. Disable FileVault disk encryption. Instructions can be found in [Apple’s support article](https://support.apple.com/kb/PH18674?locale=en_US).
2. Use the internal keyboard or built-in USB port to log in.
What impact does FileVault encryption have on USB audio devices connected to a Thunderbolt dock?

FileVault encryption may affect your default sound output device on the dock or any USB audio interface connected to the dock. This issue occurs because macOS drivers for these devices do not load until after you log in.
How can you reduce interference for a wireless keyboard and mouse connected to a docking station?
Use a USB extension cable to connect the wireless receiver to the dock. This can help minimize radio frequency interference on the 2.4 GHz ISM band.
What should you do if your Bluetooth keyboard and mouse experience lag or disconnection?
Move the dock farther away from your computer and Bluetooth devices. Keeping a distance of 1 to 1.5 feet may help reduce interference and improve stability.
Where can you find more information about reducing Wi-Fi and Bluetooth interference caused by wireless devices?

Visit [Apple’s support article](https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT201542) and [Logitech’s support article](https://support.logi.com/hc/en-ca/articles/360023414273-Wireless-product-not-working-properly-when-also-using-a-USB-3-0-device) for detailed guidance.
What should you check if your wireless keyboard or mouse disconnects or lags when using a USB docking station?
Check for radio frequency interference. Try using a USB extension cable to connect the receiver to the dock or move the dock away from your computer and wireless devices.
What should you do if your Thunderbolt docking station is not fully utilized by your Chrome OS computer?

Check if your Chrome OS computer is restricting peripheral access. Look for a warning about limited peripheral performance. If present, go to 'Security and Privacy' in Settings and disable 'Data access protection for your peripherals.' Confirm by pressing 'Disable' in the pop-up window and restart your computer.
How can you disable data access protection for peripherals on a Chrome OS computer?

Go to 'Security and Privacy' in your computer's Settings and de-select 'Data access protection for your peripherals.' This option is only available to the Administrator account. Confirm by pressing 'Disable' when prompted.
What should you check if you do not see the option to disable data access protection for peripherals on your Chrome OS computer?
If you do not see this option, your Chrome OS computer might not be using Thunderbolt 4, or it may not support Thunderbolt docking stations.
What should you do if your Thunderbolt Dock features do not work immediately after disabling data access protection on a Chrome OS computer?
Restart your computer to ensure that all Thunderbolt Dock features are activated and functioning properly.
What should you do if the Ethernet port on your CalDigit dock is not working with an RJ45 Network Splitter?

Manually configure your CalDigit Ethernet port to 100MB/s. Open 'System Preferences' -> 'Network' -> Select the CalDigit Ethernet Interface -> Click 'Advanced…' -> Go to 'Hardware' -> Change 'Configure' to 'Manually' and 'Speed' to '100baseTX' -> Click 'OK' and then 'Apply'.
How can you set the Ethernet speed to 100MB/s for a CalDigit dock in macOS?

Go to 'System Preferences' -> 'Network' -> Select the CalDigit Ethernet Interface -> Click 'Advanced…' -> Select 'Hardware' -> Set 'Configure' to 'Manually' and 'Speed' to '100baseTX' -> Click 'OK' and then 'Apply'.
Why might the Ethernet port on a CalDigit dock show no network traffic when using an RJ45 Network Splitter?

The Ethernet port might be set to 'Automatically' and 'Auto Select,' which doesn’t match the splitter’s 100MB/s capacity. Configure the port manually to 100MB/s (100BaseTX) through 'System Preferences' -> 'Network' -> Select the CalDigit Ethernet Interface -> Click 'Advanced…' -> 'Hardware' -> Set 'Configure' to 'Manually' and 'Speed' to '100baseTX'.
What are the firmware versions required for different CalDigit Thunderbolt devices?

The required firmware versions for various CalDigit Thunderbolt devices are:

- TS3 Plus: 44.1 (Not required for units purchased after November 2020)
- Element Hub: 30.3 (Not required for units purchased after July 2021)
- Connect 10G: 45.1
- TS4: 39.1 (Not required for units purchased after August 2022)
What are the requirements for updating CalDigit Thunderbolt firmware on macOS 11.2 or above?

The requirements for updating CalDigit Thunderbolt firmware on macOS 11.2 or later are:

- Intel-Based Thunderbolt 3 Mac or Apple silicon Mac
- macOS 11.2 or later
- CalDigit Thunderbolt devices (e.g., TS3 Plus, Connect-10G, Element Hub)
- CalDigit Thunderbolt Firmware Updater
What should I do if the firmware update did not complete on my CalDigit Thunderbolt device?

If the firmware update did not complete, try the following:

1. Repeat the update procedure from the beginning.
2. Ensure that you have followed all steps correctly, including downloading the latest updater and power cycling the device.
3. If the problem persists, check for any additional troubleshooting information on the CalDigit support site or contact support for further assistance.
What firmware versions are available for the CalDigit Thunderbolt devices?

The available firmware versions for CalDigit Thunderbolt devices are:
- TS3 Plus: 44.1
- Connect 10G: 45.1
What are the system requirements for updating Thunderbolt 3 firmware on macOS 10.15?

The system requirements for updating Thunderbolt 3 firmware on macOS 10.15 are:
- Intel-Based Thunderbolt 3 Mac (Apple M1-Based Mac is not supported)
- macOS 10.15
- Thunderbolt 3 product
- CalDigit Thunderbolt 3 Firmware Updater
- Computer restart is required before installing the new firmware
What should you do if you are running macOS 10.15.4 and experience issues during the firmware update?
If you are running macOS 10.15.4 and experience issues during the firmware update, update your macOS to 10.15.5 and the supplemental update before proceeding with the firmware update.
How can you verify if the firmware update was successful on your Thunderbolt 3 device?

To verify if the firmware update was successful, check the firmware version in the System Report. Connect the Thunderbolt 3 device to your computer, open the System Report, and navigate to the ‘Thunderbolt’ section. For example, the Connect 10G should show firmware version 45.1 and the TS3 Plus should show 44.1 if updated correctly.
What should you do if the firmware update process does not go as expected?
If the firmware update process does not go as expected, contact CalDigit Support for assistance. They can help troubleshoot and resolve any issues you encounter.
What should you do if your Thunderbolt 3 device is not detected when first connecting it to a Windows computer?

When first connecting a Thunderbolt 3 device, wait up to 20 seconds for Windows to display a popup message indicating that new Thunderbolt devices have been attached. If not detected, search for and launch the Intel Thunderbolt software manually. If it's not installed, download and install it from Intel’s website. If the device is still not detected, unplug all Thunderbolt devices, reboot the computer, and reconnect the devices after logging back in.
How can you authorize a Thunderbolt device in Intel Thunderbolt software on Windows?

To authorize a Thunderbolt device in Intel Thunderbolt software:
1. Click 'OK' on the 'New Thunderbolt devices have been attached' window.
2. If prompted by Windows User Account Control (UAC), click 'Yes' to allow changes.
3. In the 'Approve Thunderbolt Device' window, select the device and choose 'Always Connect' from the drop-down menu, then click 'OK'.
4. Windows will automatically install the new device. It may take up to 1 minute for all controllers to be installed and ready for use.
What should you do if you find that an authorized Thunderbolt device does not work properly?

If an authorized Thunderbolt device does not work properly, go to 'Manage Approved Devices' in the Intel Thunderbolt software. Deauthorize the device, then reauthorize it. This process can help resolve issues with the device not functioning correctly.
How can you enable Thunderbolt and USB ports in BIOS on a Windows PC?

To enable Thunderbolt and USB ports in BIOS:
1. Go to BIOS Setup.
2. Navigate to 'System Configuration' -> 'USB/Thunderbolt Configuration'.
3. Enable 'External USB Ports' and 'Thunderbolt Ports'.
4. Set the Security level to 'User Authorization'.
What additional information should you provide if contacting CalDigit support for issues with Thunderbolt devices?

When contacting CalDigit support for Thunderbolt device issues, provide the following information:
1. Thunderbolt Controller details including NVM firmware version, PD Firmware version, and Software package version.
2. Windows System Information.
You can email this information to support@caldigit.com.
Can the Element Hub be powered through the bus alone?
No, the Element Hub cannot be bus powered. It requires an external power supply to operate.
What is required for the Element Hub to operate?
The Element Hub requires its power supply to be plugged in for it to operate. It cannot function solely on bus power.
Why does my USB capture device video freeze when connected to a Thunderbolt 4 dock?
The video may freeze because the USB Transfer Mode is set to 'Bulk' or 'Auto'. Change the mode to 'Isochronous' to resolve the issue.
How can I change the USB Transfer Mode to Isochronous on a Mac?

Download and install Elgato’s 'Camera Hub' utility, launch it, select 'Cam Link 4K', hold down the 'Command' key, and click on 'Advanced Device Settings'. Change the 'USB Transfer Mode' to 'Isochronous'.
How do I adjust the USB Transfer Mode to Isochronous on a Windows PC?

Download and install Elgato’s '4K Capture Utility', launch it, hold down the 'CONTROL' key, click on 'Open Preference', select 'Cam Link 4K', and change the 'USB Transfer Mode' to 'Isochronous' in the Device tab.
What can I do to improve the signal quality between my USB capture device and Thunderbolt dock?
Remove the USB extension cable between the capture device and the dock to improve signal quality.
Can I use Sidecar with TS4?
Yes, you can use Sidecar with TS4 by connecting your iPad to its downstream Thunderbolt port, USB-C, or USB-A port to use it as an external display for your Mac.
What should I do if there is a timeout error when using Sidecar with TS4?
You may need to reboot both your Mac and iPad if there is a timeout error.
Where can I find more information about Apple Sidecar?
For more information about Apple Sidecar, visit https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT210380.
Do all CalDigit docks support Sidecar?
Yes, all CalDigit docks and hubs support Sidecar through Thunderbolt 4, USB-C, and USB-A ports. TS3 Plus supports Sidecar over USB-C and USB-A but not the downstream Thunderbolt 3 port.
Can CalDigit Thunderbolt docks support Thunderbolt networking?
Yes, all CalDigit Thunderbolt docks with more than one Thunderbolt port support Thunderbolt networking, allowing you to use IP over Thunderbolt to connect two computers together.
Can you connect more than two computers using Thunderbolt networking with an Element Hub?

No, Thunderbolt networking can only support 2 computers. With the Element Hub, you can connect one computer to the [Computer] port and another to a downstream Thunderbolt port. Adding a third computer will disrupt the Thunderbolt networking.
What is the maximum cable length for Thunderbolt networking?
Thunderbolt cables are limited to a length of up to 2 meters, so the maximum distance you can achieve between two computers through a CalDigit Thunderbolt dock is up to 4 meters.
Does Windows support Thunderbolt networking?
Yes, Windows supports Thunderbolt networking. Ensure you update to the latest Windows version.
What issue is being reported with Intel-based macOS computers connected to Thunderbolt 3 devices?
Intel-based macOS computers are experiencing kernel panics when connected to Thunderbolt 3 devices, including docking stations, particularly with macOS Catalina and newer.
What steps should you take to avoid crashes when undocking or re-docking your Intel-based Mac?

Ensure that your Mac's lid is open and that the computer is fully out of sleep mode before undocking or re-docking. Allow a few seconds for the operating system to respond after waking from sleep mode.
How long should you wait before undocking or re-docking your Mac to prevent kernel panics?
It is advised to wait 3-5 seconds before closing the lid after undocking, or open the lid 3-5 seconds before re-docking, to minimize panic issues.
What specific macOS versions are affected by the kernel panics when using Thunderbolt 3 devices?
The issue has been observed with macOS Catalina and newer versions.
Why might your Intel-based Mac take a few seconds to respond after waking from sleep mode?
After waking from sleep mode, the operating system may take a few seconds to start responding, which is why it's recommended to wait before undocking or re-docking.
What is one of the first things to try if your external monitor connected to a USB-C dock is flickering?
Try using a shorter video cable, such as a 3-feet HDMI to HDMI cable.
What type of cable should you use to connect from the dock to your host machine to avoid monitor flickering?
Use CalDigit's cable to connect from the dock to your host machine.
What should you do to ensure your operating system and graphics card drivers are not causing monitor flickering?
Update your OS and GPU drivers to the latest version.
What is another troubleshooting step if your external monitor is flickering?
Try connecting a different monitor to see if the flickering persists.
What specific action should you take if you are using a Mac and experience monitor flickering?
Reset the NVRAM on your Mac.
What type of adapter or cable is required to connect a DVI-D monitor to the DisplayPort on a USB-C Dock?
An active DisplayPort to DVI-D adapter or cable is required. A regular passive DisplayPort to DVI cable will not work.
What is an example of how to connect an LG 27MP38VQ monitor to a USB-C Dock?
You can connect the LG 27MP38VQ monitor to the USB-C Dock via an active DisplayPort to Female DVI-D adapter and a passive DVI-D to DVI-D cable.
What is the setup for connecting a DVI-D monitor to a USB-C Dock?
Apple MacBook 2016 — CalDigit USB-C Dock — Active DisplayPort to DVI adapter — DVI cable — LG 27MP38VQ Monitor
What should you use if you want to connect a monitor with VGA and DVI-D inputs to a USB-C Dock?
You can use a DisplayPort to VGA cable or an active DisplayPort to Female DVI-D adapter to a passive DVI-D to DVI-D cable.
What should you do if your USB keyboard and mouse do not work during macOS login with FileVault encryption enabled?
You should use the internal keyboard or connect the keyboard directly to the Mac's built-in USB port to log in.
Why do USB devices not work during the macOS login process with FileVault encryption enabled?

FileVault utilizes the EFI pre-boot environment for handling the password and login, so none of the macOS drivers will load until you log in, causing USB devices connected to the Thunderbolt dock to be unresponsive.
What impact does FileVault encryption have on the default sound output device?

FileVault encryption can affect your default sound device on the dock or any USB audio interface connected to the dock, making it not possible to keep the audio interface as the default output device across macOS restarts.
What are the two possible solutions if you experience issues with USB devices and default sound output due to FileVault encryption?
1. Disable the FileVault disk encryption using this link: https://support.apple.com/kb/PH18674?locale=en_US. 2. Use the internal keyboard or connect the keyboard to the built-in USB port to log in.
How can I fix the Ethernet port on TS4 or TS3 Plus that is not obtaining an IP address or has no network traffic on macOS?

Remove all unused Thunderbolt Ethernet Slots in Network preferences, create a new network service for the dock, and disable 'Energy Efficient Ethernet' by setting 'Configure' to 'Manual' and choosing the appropriate speed.
What should I do if the Ethernet port on TS4 or TS3 Plus shows a red dot and is 'Not connected' on macOS?
Plug cycle your Thunderbolt and network cables, then try again. If the problem persists, disable 'Energy Efficient Ethernet' by configuring the speed and duplex settings manually.
How can I ensure that the Ethernet port on TS4 or TS3 Plus works properly on a Windows computer?

Ensure your Windows computer supports PCIe over USB4. Install the Intel Thunderbolt driver and give TS4 connection permission. Download and install the Windows driver for TS4’s Ethernet controller if needed.
What should I do if the Ethernet port on TS4 or TS3 Plus does not work with a USB-C 3.x computer?
Purchase a USB-A to Ethernet adapter to provide Ethernet connectivity when connected to TS4.
How do I disable 'Energy Efficient Ethernet' on Windows?
Go to Network Settings under Control Panel, select the Ethernet controller associated with the dock, click on Properties, go to the 'Advanced' tab, and set 'Energy Efficient Ethernet' to 'Off'.
What feature on Cisco switches or routers might interfere with the Ethernet port on TS4 or TS3 Plus?
The 'Auto Smartport' feature may interfere. Disable this feature on the Cisco router if the dock’s Ethernet port cannot connect to the network switch.
What should I do if video is not working when connecting DisplayPort to HDMI/VGA/DVI?
Please make sure to use an active adapter. Otherwise, check your cable to ensure it is using DP 1.2 or higher.
What should I check if the monitor connected to DisplayPort on CalDigit’s Thunderbolt Dock has no video output?
Check the monitor input settings and cable/adapter connections. Use CalDigit’s Thunderbolt cable, not Apple’s USB-C 2m white charging cable or 3rd party cables.
What type of cable should be used for DisplayPort -> DisplayPort or DisplayPort -> mini DisplayPort monitors?
Use a high quality DisplayPort 1.2 cable.
What should be used for DisplayPort -> HDMI monitors or TVs?
Use an active DisplayPort to HDMI adapter or cable. Regular passive cables or adapters do not work.
What is required for DisplayPort -> DVI monitors?
Use an active DisplayPort to DVI adapter or cable.
How should I connect DisplayPort to Dual-Link DVI monitors?
Use a regular DisplayPort to mini DisplayPort (mDP) dongle, then connect it to Apple’s mini DisplayPort to Dual-Link DVI Adapter and then to the DVI-D monitor.
What should be used for DisplayPort -> VGA monitors?
Use an active DisplayPort to VGA adapter or cable.
What should Windows users with Nvidia graphics cards do if video is not working through Thunderbolt dock?
Update to the latest Windows driver. Download and install the latest driver from Nvidia at https://www.nvidia.com/Download/Find.aspx
What happens if I connect two power sources to my Type-C computer?

Modern Type-C computers are smart enough to choose which power source is right for them. It will only draw power from one of the several sources, usually the one that most closely matches its power requirements.
Can connecting multiple power sources to a Type-C computer damage it?
No, modern Type-C computers are designed to select the appropriate power source and will only draw power from the source that best matches its needs.
What should I check if my Thunderbolt 3 device appears as a USB device in macOS?

Ensure that your computer is Thunderbolt enabled, you are connected to a Thunderbolt 3 enabled USB-C port, and you are using the provided CalDigit Thunderbolt 3 cable. Then power cycle your computer, try a different Thunderbolt port, and on a Mac, reset the NVRAM & SMC.
Why does my Thunderbolt 3 device show up as USB in the macOS system profile?

This issue may occur if your computer is not Thunderbolt enabled, if you are not using a Thunderbolt 3 enabled USB-C port, or if you are not using the provided CalDigit Thunderbolt 3 cable. Ensure these conditions are met, then power cycle your computer, try another Thunderbolt port, and reset the NVRAM & SMC on a Mac.
What should I do if my CalDigit dock does not output sound on Windows 10?

First, ensure that you approve the Thunderbolt connection for your dock. This is necessary for the dock’s controllers, including the audio controller, to be recognized by your Windows machine. Follow the instructions here: Thunderbolt 3 Devices in Windows 10 platform. Then, check that your dock is set as the 'Output Device' in your Windows Sound Playback Options. For instance, set your default playback device to 'Speakers (CalDigit Thunderbolt 3 Audio)'. If you still face issues, go to your Sound control panel, open 'Properties', click on 'Advanced', and uncheck 'Allow applications to take exclusive control of this device'. After applying these changes, restart any media applications and check if the sound output issue is resolved.
How do I fix sound output issues with my CalDigit dock on Windows 10?

Ensure that you have approved the Thunderbolt connection for your dock, as this is required for the dock’s audio controller to be detected. Approve the connection as described here: Thunderbolt 3 Devices in Windows 10 platform. Make sure your dock is set as the 'Output Device' in the Sound Playback Options of Windows. For example, select 'Speakers (CalDigit Thunderbolt 3 Audio)' for a TS3 Plus dock. If the issue continues, access your Sound control panel, go to 'Properties', click on the 'Advanced' tab, and disable 'Allow applications to take exclusive control of this device'. Exit and restart any relevant media applications to see if the sound output is restored.
What can I do if I get HDCP errors on Safari with external monitors through a CalDigit dock?

If you encounter HDCP errors when playing content like Netflix, YouTube, or Hulu via Safari on an external display connected through a CalDigit USB-C Dock or Video Adapter, you may see an error message like: 'There appears to be a display problem. Please ensure your monitor is HDCP compliant and is not mirrored using Airplay.' Try switching to another browser, such as Google Chrome or Firefox, to see if that resolves the issue.
How can I fix HDCP playback errors on Safari with my CalDigit dock?

To fix HDCP playback errors on Safari when using an external monitor with a CalDigit USB-C Dock or Video Adapter, follow these steps: if you see an error message such as: 'There appears to be a display problem. Please ensure your monitor is HDCP compliant and is not mirrored using Airplay,' switch to a different browser like Google Chrome or Firefox for HDCP content playback.
Why is my external monitor flickering with a 2 meter Thunderbolt 3 cable and Lenovo laptop?

Certain devices, including Lenovo’s Thunderbolt 3 dock, may experience functionality issues with active cables (such as our 1 and 2 meter). Please use passive cables instead. Customers using the 2 meter long Thunderbolt 3 cable with Thunderbolt 3 dock and some Lenovo computers, such as Thinkpad X1 Carbon 6th Gen, Thinkpad X280, may experience issues with their connected displays flickering, Ethernet disconnection or USB drive dropout after extended use. This is due to a vast and diverse Thunderbolt 3 hardware landscape which makes it difficult to account for every hardware variation present in the different Thunderbolt 3 devices and hosts currently on the market. As a result we have discovered that the 2 meter Thunderbolt 3 active cable may run into certain video and disconnecting issues with any Thunderbolt 3 setup when connecting to some Lenovo computers.
How can I resolve flickering issues with a 2 meter Thunderbolt 3 cable on a Lenovo laptop?

For instance, if you have a ThinkPad X280, when using the CalDigit Thunderbolt 3 Active cable with a Lenovo’s Thunderbolt 3 dock or CalDigit TS3 Plus, users may notice that the video on their connected display(s) blink on and off after extended use. This is due to an inherent hardware difference between the 2 meter CalDigit Thunderbolt 3 Active cable and the Thunderbolt dock’s handling of video streams. In this case, please contact your Thunderbolt 3 device or host vendor to verify if your equipment is capable of using 2m cable. Some devices or host machines may only be able to connect with 1 meter or less than 1 meter cable. Some devices may also require video firmware update from time to time. Please check with your vendor. You can also use a 0.5m or 0.7m Thunderbolt 3 cable if the entire setup is not working properly with 2m cable.
Does the 2 meter Thunderbolt 3 cable cause issues with CalDigit hardware?

This issue is NOT present when the 2 meter CalDigit Thunderbolt 3 cable is used with any of CalDigit Thunderbolt 3 hardware including the TS3 and TS3 Lite docking stations to connect to Mac, Dell, and HP computers.
Is the CalDigit Thunderbolt 3 Dock compatible with Apple Thunderbolt Displays?

CalDigit Thunderbolt 3 Docking Stations including TS3 Plus, TS3 and TS3 Lite as well as T4 Thunderbolt 3 RAID are compatible with the Apple Thunderbolt Display (Thunderbolt 1 & 2 versions). Apple’s Thunderbolt 3 (USB-C) to Thunderbolt 2 adapter is required to connect in between the dock’s Thunderbolt 3 port and Thunderbolt 1/2 display.
How can I connect two Apple Thunderbolt 2 displays to the CalDigit Thunderbolt 3 Dock?

You can daisy chain up to TWO Thunderbolt 2 displays from a single Thunderbolt 3 bus. Below is the setup to show 2018 MacBook Pro, CalDigit TS3+, Apple adapter and two Apple Thunderbolt 2 displays connecting together.
Can TS3 and TS3 Plus support DisplayPort Multi-stream Transport (MST) feature?
MacOS does not currently support MST, and will be able to mirror monitors at best. If you are experiencing problems on Windows, please make sure that you are using DP 1.2 cables and monitors.
What are the types of MST (Multi-Stream Transport Technology)?

In a nutshell, there are 3 types of MSTs:

1. MST Tiled
2. MST Hub (MST Splitter or DisplayPort Splitter)
3. MST Daisy-Chained
What is MST Tiled and how is it supported?

MST Tiled: Most early 4K @60Hz monitors on the market, such as Sharp PN-K321, ASUS PQ321Q, Dell UP2414Q and UP3214Q, Panasonic TC-L65WT600 … etc, used Multi-Stream Transport technology to put two halves of a display together onto one large 4K surface to reach 60Hz (Stream 1 + Stream 2). This technique is also referred to as a 'tile.' (Monitor with more than one panel). This is the MST fully supported by macOS.
What is MST Hub and how does macOS handle it?

MST Hub: MST hub is a device that splits the total bandwidth from a DisplayPort 1.2 source to multiple video connections allowing users to connect to more than one monitor simultaneously. MST Hubs can be configures for Mirrored (Duplicated), Extended, or video wall mode. MST hubs require that the video card’s DisplayPort output support DP1.2 or greater, which supports MST. It is important to note that although some video cards can technically support DP1.2, it may not be supporting MST. Please always check with your video card manufacturer to verify MST compatibility. Currently, macOS can only support MST hub in 'Mirrored' mode. Users, however, can use BootCamp to run Windows on a late model Mac for MST hub 'Extended' mode.
What is MST Daisy-Chained and how does it work?

MST Daisy-Chained Monitors: DisplayPort v1.2 supports daisy chainable displays having both a DisplayPort input and a DisplayPort output from one monitor. The DisplayPort output connects to the next downstream monitor.
How does macOS and Windows handle MST?

Currently, Macs running on macOS with Thunderbolt 3 ports can ONLY support MST tiled display that uses MST to accomplish the tiling technique as described above for one 4K Display. When connecting to MST Hub and MST daisy-chained displays, macOS will show them in cloned mode (mirrored), not extended mode. On the other hand, Windows 10 supports MST Hub and MST Daisy-Chainable monitors to show in Extended mode (2 separate contents). Similar results can also be achieved with a Mac running BootCamp on Windows to show Extended Mode.
My Monitor Can Not Enter Power Save Mode.
If your monitor cannot enter power save mode, please power cycle your monitor by disconnecting it from power for at least 30 seconds, then make sure that “monitor sleep” features are disabled.
What should I do if the monitor does not enter power saving mode even when the computer is asleep?

When connecting a monitor to a CalDigit Dock or a Display-supported storage solution, you may find the monitor can not enter power saving mode even when your computer entered sleep mode. If this is the case, you may try to update firmware on your monitor or reset it to factory default and turn off any built-in “Monitor Sleep” features on the display.
How can I reset the Dell U2718Q monitor to resolve power save mode issues?

Take the Dell U2718Q monitor as an example. While your computer is in sleep mode, the Dell monitor may keep cycling “Scanning for signal…” and “No DP signal from your devices” messages and the monitor itself will not power off. In this case, you may reset the monitor and turn off its internal sleep feature from the monitor’s menu settings. This will allow the display to take sleep commands from the connected host computer when it enters sleep mode. You can do this by:

Disconnect all the cables from the Dell U2718Q (including the power cable).
Press and hold in the U2718Q power button for 30 seconds.
Reconnect the power cable and Dock to the U2718Q. Power on the monitor.
Go U2718Q OSD menu, and disable “Monitor Sleep” which is under “Personalize” sub-menu.
Power cycle the monitor.
My Windows computer will only connect to one monitor at a time on my Thunderbolt 3 dock!

If your Windows computer is unable to connect to one monitor at a time using any of our Thunderbolt 3 docks, your computer may be unable to produce two video signals from the Thunderbolt 3 port that the dock is connected to.
How can I determine if my computer is capable of producing two video signals from the Thunderbolt 3 port?

You can easily determine if this is the case by disconnecting one ‘working’ monitor from your dock and see if the other monitor comes back on. If this is the case, you may have a computer that was made lacking this capability.
What is an alternative method to produce dual extended displays if my computer cannot handle two video signals?

If this is the case, you may still be able to produce dual extended displays through the use of MST (multi-stream transport) through the DisplayPort port. This can be done through an MST Hub connected to the dock or through certain monitors which have both a DisplayPort in and DisplayPort out port.
Are there any limitations when using MST to connect dual monitors?

Please note: this technique may limit your display capabilities. Using this configuration, one monitor will be limited to a 4k resolution at 30Hz refresh rate and the other will be limited to 2k resolution at 60Hz refresh rate.
What should I check if my displays aren’t showing up on the TS3 Plus dock?

If you’ve plugged in one or more displays into your TS3 Plus dock and they aren’t showing up, please check to see if you are connected through the correct ports, using the correct cables and adapters, and using a computer that can support dual video streams out of a single Thunderbolt 3 port.
What can cause video cables to not connect to a display?

Due to various reasons some video cables are unable to connect to a display. Typical causes are physical wear and tear, an adapter that isn’t working, or too many adapters chained together to produce a strong signal. If you are using any cable with connector pins, please ensure that these pins are in good condition and are not bent or broken. To check to see if your cable is working, try to connect the display directly to a computer first.
Which ports on the TS3 Plus produce video?

On the TS3 Plus, the only ports that produce video are the Thunderbolt 3 ports and the DisplayPort. If you are trying to connect a monitor to a USB port, this will not be able to produce stable video signals.
What type of adapters should I use when connecting DisplayPort to HDMI, VGA, or DVI?

If you are using an adapter or cable to go from DisplayPort to HDMI, VGA, or DVI, please ensure that this is active. If you are unsure if you have an active cable or adapter rather than a passive one, please check the packaging or website and see if it is labeled specifically. If you don’t already have one, we make one that works well with our docks – you can find a link here.
How can I test if my computer supports dual video streams from a single Thunderbolt 3 port?

Some computers are equipped with Thunderbolt 3 ports which are not capable of producing two video streams out at the same time. If you are not able to get your second monitor to connect, an easy way to test if this is the case is to manually disconnect a working monitor to see if the second one pops up. If your computer isn’t able to connect to two monitors through the same port, you can always connect a second monitor to your existing setup by connecting the second monitor directly to the computer.
What should I do if I need help with connecting displays to the TS3 Plus?
If you have any questions about this or would like one of our support team members to walk you through these step by step, please contact our support department and we’d be happy to help you.
How do I adjust the display resolution on a Mac OSX?

By default, Mac OSX chooses the most suitable resolution based on factors such as your monitors, GPU, Thunderbolt capability, and other settings. However, it is possible to adjust the resolution yourself.

Follow the steps below to adjust the resolution:

1. Choose Apple menu > System Preferences, then click Displays.

2. If you connect more than one monitor, you can select “Gather Windows” so that all of the preference windows gather on the primary monitor.

3. Click “Display” on the window associated to the monitor you would like to change, then click Scaled and select a resolution. The resolution list on “Scaled” shows all the possible resolutions possible with your current setup depending on factors such as:

Hardware Specifications: GPU/Video Card, Processor, Thunderbolt, HDMI, Display, cable. Software Specifications: Mac OS X version and software drivers.

You may verify the changes by going to the “Graphics/Displays” section in your system profile. For example, the following shows the display setup of a MacBook Pro 11,1 (Thunderbolt 2) and a Thunderbolt Station 2 HDMI output going to a Samsung U28D590 4K monitor @ 30Hz in 3840×2160.
